definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The founders hope to begin training imams sometime next year.
sentences.chinese: 創辦者希望明年某個時候開始培養伊瑪目。

sentences.english: Rani Rasmani, the foundress of the temple garden, passed away in 1861.
sentences.chinese: 廟宇花園的創辦者拉妮羅曼妮於1861年去世。

sentences.english: I am proud to be a co-founder of this important initiative.
sentences.chinese: 能成爲這一重要倡議的共同創辦者，我很自豪。

sentences.english: Both firms' founders were early practitioners of the lean startup method.
sentences.chinese: 兩家公司的創辦者是薄本起家方法的早期實踐者。

sentences.english: In fact, he was the one to have founded the center.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，他是這個中心的創辦者之一。

definition: Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
Pei Ieoh Ming or I.M. Pei (1917-2019), Chinese-American architect
Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
